alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 1:09PM CDT until July 04 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Bureau County in north central Illinois... Northeastern Henry IL County in northwestern Illinois... * Until 715 PM CDT Monday. * At 109 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Princeton, Hennepin, Geneseo, Wyanet, Atkinson, Sheffield, Annawan, Tiskilwa, Buda, Bureau Junction, Hooppole, Malden, Manlius, Mineral, Dover, New Bedford, Thomas, Bureau County Fairgrounds, Coal Hollow and Zearing. This includes the following highways... Interstate 180 between mile markers 2 and 13. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 15 and 64. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
